thread.title: Manchester United in for Benfica's Nelson Semedo? Transfer news and gossip from Monday's papers
thread.title_full: Manchester United in for Benfica's Nelson Semedo? Transfer news and gossip from Monday's papers

author: Football Spy
title: Manchester United in for Benfica's Nelson Semedo? Transfer news and gossip from Monday's papers
text:
Sport Manchester United in for Benfica's Nelson Semedo? Transfer news and gossip from Monday's papers PLUS: Arsene Wenger WILL stay at Arsenal AND Cesare Prandelli rejected Leicester due to their treatment of Claudio Ranieri Share Nelson Semedo is turning heads among Europe's elite clubs (Photo: AFP) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United will face stiff competition if they wish to move ahead with plans to sign Benfica's talented right-back Nelson Semedo. 
The highly-rated 23-year-old has been turning heads with his displays for the Portuguese outfit this season. 
And according to OJogo , European heavyweights Juventus and AC Milan are both also interested in securing the Portugal international's services. 
The prolific right-back has previously also been linked with the likes of Barcelona, Bayern Munich and Inter Milan. The Benfica right-back has put in a string of impressive performances (Photo: Getty) Read More Barcelona target Liverpool ace Philippe Coutinho and PSG star Marco Verratti to replace Andres Iniesta Top stories from Monday's Mirror 
Arsene Wenger has decided he wants to STAY at Arsenal. Manager Wenger will have talks with the Gunners' board after admitting publicly that he has made up his mind on his future — although insiders insist no final decision has been taken and no imminent announcement is expected. Read More Arsene Wenger set to STAY at Arsenal — even if they miss the Champions League for first time under him Arsene Wenger is planning to stay at the Emirates next season (Photo: PA) 
West Ham manager Slaven Bilic is back under pressure after co-owner David Sullivan apologised to fans for their home defeat to Leicester. The Irons have now won just one of their last seven to fall into the bottom half of the table. Sullivan warned Bilic and his men to stop conceding early goals last week after they were beaten at Bournemouth - only to see his club ship two in opening seven minutes against the Foxes. 
Barcelona are lining up Liverpool ace Philippe Coutinho and PSG man Marco Verratti as they prepare to replace club legend Andres Iniesta , who has been a pro for 17 years and is closing in on 700 appearances. 
Spurs have AC Milan ex-Liverpool attacking midfielder Suso among their summer transfer options. 
Manchester City scouts were set to be in Germany again on Sunday afternoon to further check out Borussia Monchengladbach’s Mahmoud Dahoud . Gladbach's Mahmoud Dahoud is a target for Manchester City (Photo: Bongarts/Getty Images) 
Chelsea believe they are in pole position to land Monaco midfielder Tiemoue Bakayoko . 
Timo Werner has ruled out a summer move to Liverpool or Bayern Munich. RB Leipzig striker Werner had been touted for a move to the two European giants - with Tottenham also long-term admirers. But the 21-year-old claims he wants to continue his development out of the limelight with highly rated boss Ralph Hasenhuttl. 
Leicester's Marc Albrighton admits he won't be surprised if some of European football's giants move for Foxes keeper Kasper Shcmeichel in the summer — but warns not many could afford him. Read More AC Milan's Suso could move to Spurs (Photo: REUTERS) Transfer news from other newspapers and websites 
Italy's former head coach Cesare Prandelli says he turned down an approach from Leicester because of their treatment of compatriot Claudio Ranieri (SFR). Cesare Prandelli says he turned down Leicester (Photo: Action Images) 
Barcelona are in the hunt for the 'next Neymar', Brazil U17 winger Vinicius Junior, who has been attracting the attention of Real Madrid, Arsenal and Chelsea (The Sun). 
Manchester City's brass is confident they can put together a package to entice five-time World Player of the Year Lionel Messi to the Etihad (Express). poll loading Will Manchester United sign Nelson Semedo? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
